description: A collection of options for the individual nodes. The nodes in a networkgraph diagram are auto-generated instances of Highcharts.Point, but options can be applied here and linked by the id.

children.name: color
children.description: The color of the auto generated node.

children.name: colorIndex
children.description: The color index of the auto generated node, especially for use in styled mode.

children.name: dataLabels
children.description: Individual data label for each node. The options are the same as the ones for series.networkgraph.dataLabels.

children.name: id
children.description: The id of the auto-generated node, refering to the from or to setting of the link.

children.name: mass
children.description:
Mass of the node. By default, each node has mass equal to it's marker radius . Mass is used to determine how two connected nodes should affect each other:

Attractive force is multiplied by the ratio of two connected nodes; if a big node has weights twice as the small one, then the small one will move towards the big one twice faster than the big one to the small one .

children.name: name
children.description: The name to display for the node in data labels and tooltips. Use this when the name is different from the id. Where the id must be unique for each node, this is not necessary for the name.
